sparse2full.py - convert a sparse matrix to adjacency matrix¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Purpose¶

convert a sparse matrix to adjacency matrix and vice versa.

Usage¶

Example:

python sparse2full.py --help

Type:

python sparse2full.py --help

for command line help.

Command line options¶

Usage: sparse2full.py [options]

Options:
  --version             show program's version number and exit
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --no-usage            output help without usage information
  -m METHODS, --method=METHODS
                        method to use [normalize-by-min-diagonal|normalize-by-
                        column|
                                              log|ln|negzero2value|normalize-
                        by-matrix|subtract-matrix|mix-matrix|
                                              normalize-by-column-max
                        |normalize-by-row-max|correspondence-analysis|
                                              transpose|upper-bound|lower-
                        bound
                        
  -f FORMAT, --format=FORMAT
                        format.
  -o OUTPUT_FORMAT, --output-format=OUTPUT_FORMAT
                        output format.
  -i INPUT_FORMAT, --input-format=INPUT_FORMAT
                        input format.
  -a, --asymmetric      matrix is asymmetric.
  -d DEFAULT, --default=DEFAULT
                        default value for missing values.
  -D DEFAULT_DIAGONAL, --default-diagonal=DEFAULT_DIAGONAL
                        default value for missing values on diagonal.
  -r ROW_NAMES, --row-names=ROW_NAMES
                        list of row names separated by ','.
  -c COL_NAMES, --col-names=COL_NAMES
                        list of col names separated by ','.
  --file-row-names=FILE_ROW_NAMES
                        filename with row names.
  --file-col-names=FILE_COL_NAMES
                        filename with col names.
  --full2sparse         convert full to sparse matrix.
  --skip-separators     do not echo separators (starting with >)
  -n, --numeric         row and column titles are numeric (for sorting).
  --filter-numcols=FILTER_NUMCOLS
                        only output matrices with # columns.
  --filter-numrows=FILTER_NUMROWS
                        only output matrices with # rows.
  --filename-map=FILENAME_MAP
                        filename with mapping between input and output chunks.
  -v LOGLEVEL, --verbose=LOGLEVEL
                        loglevel [1]. The higher, the more output.
  --timeit=TIMEIT_FILE  store timeing information in file [none].
  --timeit-name=TIMEIT_NAME
                        name in timing file for this class of jobs [all].
  --timeit-header       add header for timing information [none].
  --random-seed=RANDOM_SEED
                        random seed to initialize number generator with
                        [none].
  -I FILE, --stdin=FILE
                        file to read stdin from [default = stdin].
  -L FILE, --log=FILE   file with logging information [default = stdout].
  -E FILE, --error=FILE
                        file with error information [default = stderr].
  -S FILE, --stdout=FILE
                        file where output is to go [default = stdout].
